project_description: A simple Flutter app that toggles text between 'Cat' and 'Dog' when clicked.
architecture_overview: The project follows a clean architecture with separation of concerns among UI, state management, and data models. The Cubit pattern is used for state management.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
participant PetCubit
participant PetTextWidget
User -> PetTextWidget : Tap
PetTextWidget -> PetCubit : togglePet()
PetCubit -> PetCubit : update state
PetCubit -> PetTextWidget : new state
@enduml
state_management_flow: The PetCubit manages the state of the pet text. When the user taps the text, the PetTextWidget triggers the togglePet method in the PetCubit, which updates the state. The UI reacts to state changes by displaying the updated text.
navigation_flow: The app has a single screen, HomeScreen, which displays the PetTextWidget. There is no navigation to other screens.
